definition: to assume personal responsibility (idiom); to take charge of a section
alone/independent/single/sole/only
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
(onom.) dong/ding dong (bell)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: Even with Rasheed Wallace out, he would have been there to do the job.
sentences.chinese: 即使是拉希德有伤，大本依然能够独当一面。

sentences.english: In a few years, these stars are big enough to continue on their own.
sentences.chinese: 用不了几年，他们就可以独当一面。

sentences.english: Do you enjoy working by yourself or as part of a team?
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢独当一面，还是团队合作？

sentences.english: He is always hemming and hawing over things; he is lacking in the ability to take charge.
sentences.chinese: 他做事总是犹豫不决，缺乏独当一面的能力。

sentences.english: Sports advertising dominates all other forms.
sentences.chinese: 体育广告在所有形式的广告里都独当一面。

sentences.english: No question, because it can't be a democracy.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，他可以独当一面。

sentences.english: It will be another year before the cubs can hunt for themselves.
sentences.chinese: 幼狮要到一年之后才能独当一面。

sentences.english: He's matured quickly, He can now take charge of the whole locality.
sentences.chinese: 他成长很快，已经可以独当一面了。

definition: to play a leading role/to bear a heavy responsibility
qualified/competent (professionally)/to be up to a task
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
to charge and break through enemy lines
to learn through experience/experience/practiced/experienced
first sign of budding talent/to display one's ability for the first time
to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
mainstay/cornerstone/tower of strength
a galaxy of talent (idiom)/a great number of competent people
to take upon oneself/to assume
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
lit. to devise battle plan in a tent (idiom)/fig. planning strategies
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
fully fledged
multi-talented person/versatile person/all-rounder
